sources.title: "The Song Of The Shirt" (1908) director D. W. Griffith starring Florence Lawrence
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "The Song of the Shirt" is a short, but poignant social drama.  The film is included in our program to illustrate the contributions of our stars Florence Lawrence and cinematographer Billy Bitzer. Arthur Johnson has a small part as a waiter, and Robert Harron appears as a stock boy. A young seamstress desperately looks for work, trying to help her very sick sister. Directed by                       D.W. Griffith Cinematography by         Billy Bitzer Based on                             the poem written by Thomas Hood Starring                             Florence Lawrence, Linda Arvidson Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                      November 17, 1908 Country                             United States Running time                    8 m. metadata.Plot: Struggling with poverty and a relative's declining health, a young woman struggles to find employment.
metadata.Writer: D.W. Griffith, Thomas Hood, Frank E. Woods
metadata.Actors: Florence Lawrence, Linda Arvidson, Robert Harron
